vulnerability.name: Server header
vulnerability.description: The server header for the remote web server is: "Apache-Coyote/1.1".

http-response.body:
鐠佸彞璐熸＃鏍\xad\xe3\x80\x89 | 閺\x80\xe6儼妫岄張\xac\xe9銆\x89 | English Version | 鐢痋xae\xe5濮\xaa

閻㈤潧鐡欓柇\xae\xe7\xae\xb1閻ц\xaf\xb2缍\x8d

  
閻\xa2\xe3劍鍩涢崥\x8d
鐎靛棎\x80\x80閻甛x81  
闁璡xae\xe4娆㈢化鑽ょ埠 闁璡xae\xe4娆㈤張宥呭\xa7\x9f閸\xa3\\xa8 娴间椒绗熼柇\xae\xe7\xae\xb1 娴间椒绗熼柇\xae\xe7\xae\xb1
閳ユ窅opyright ©濞撳懎宕曟径褍\xad\xa6閻㈢喓澧块崠璇瞈xad\xa6闁璡xae\xe4娆㈢化鑽ょ埠"

vulnerability.name: Favicon identification failed
vulnerability.description: Favicon identification failed. If the remote site is using framework that is being exposed by its favicon, please send an email to w3af-develop@lists.sourceforge.net including this md5 hash "ad74ff8f9a2f630fc2c5e6b3aa0a5cb8" and the name of the server or Web application it represents. New fingerprints make this plugin more powerful and accurate.

vulnerability.name: DNS wildcard
vulnerability.description: The target site has a DNS wildcard configuration, the contents of "http://biomed.tsinghua.edu.cn/" are equal to the ones of "http://mail.biomed.tsinghua.edu.cn/".

http-response.body:
璁句负棣栭〉 | 鏀惰棌鏈\xac\xe9〉 | English Version | 甯\xae\xe5姪

鐢靛瓙閭\xae\xe7\xae\xb1鐧诲綍

  
鐢ㄦ埛鍚\x8d
瀵嗐\x80\x80鐮\x81  
閭\xae\xe4欢绯荤粺 閭\xae\xe4欢鏈嶅姟鍣\xa8 浼佷笟閭\xae\xe7\xae\xb1 浼佷笟閭\xae\xe7\xae\xb1
鈥淐opyright ©娓呭崕澶у\xad\xa6鐢熺墿鍖诲\xad\xa6閭\xae\xe4欢绯荤粺"

vulnerability.name: DAV incorrect configuration
vulnerability.description: DAV seems to be correctly configured and allowing you to use the PUT method but the directory does not have the right permissions that would allow the web server to write to it. This error was found at: "http://mail.biomed.tsinghua.edu.cn/kdUdT".

http-response.body:
HTTP Status 403 -

type Status report

message

description Access to the specified resource () has been forbidden.

Apache Tomcat/6.0.35

HTTP 404 \xe9\x94\x99\xe8\xaf\xaf
浣\xa0\xe6\x9f\xa5\xe7\x9c\x8b\xe7\x9a\x84缃\x91\xe9〉涓\x8d\xe5\xad\x98\xe5\x9c\xa8\xef\xbc\x8c\xe6\x88\x96\xe5凡\xe6\x9b存\x94\xb9杞\xac\xe7Щ锛\x8c
璇锋\xa3\x80\xe6\x9f\xa5 URL 骞剁‘淇\x9d\xe5\x85\xb6\xe6\x8b煎\x86\x99姝ｇ‘\xe3\x80\x82\r

vulnerability.name: JMX Invoker enabled without Auth
vulnerability.description: JMX Invoker enables attackers to send any JMX command to JBoss AS

vulnerability.name: Operating system
vulnerability.description: Fingerprinted this host as a *nix system. Detection for this operating system is weak, "if not windows then linux".

vulnerability.name: Internal hostname in HTML link
vulnerability.description: The content of "http://mail.biomed.tsinghua.edu.cn/" references a non existent domain: "www.coremail.cn". This can be a broken link, or an internal domain name.

vulnerability.name: Allowed HTTP methods
vulnerability.description: The URL "http://mail.biomed.tsinghua.edu.cn/" has the following enabled HTTP methods: GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, POLL, POST, REPORT
vulnerability.long-description:
There are a number of HTTP methods that can be used on a webserver (`OPTIONS`, `HEAD`, `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE` etc.). Each of these methods perform a different function and each have an associated level of risk when their use is permitted on the webserver.
A client can use the `OPTIONS` method within a request to query a server to determine which methods are allowed.
Cyber-criminals will almost always perform this simple test as it will give a very quick indication of any high-risk methods being permitted by the server. The tool discovered that several methods are supported by the server.
vulnerability.fix-guidance:
It is recommended that a whitelisting approach be taken to explicitly permit the HTTP methods required by the application and block all others.
Typically the only HTTP methods required for most applications are `GET` and `POST`. All other methods perform actions that are rarely required or perform actions that are inherently risky. These risky methods (such as `PUT`, `DELETE`, etc) should be protected by strict limitations, such as ensuring that the channel is secure (SSL/TLS enabled) and only authorised and trusted clients are permitted to use them.

http-response.body:

vulnerability.name: Click-Jacking vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The whole target has no protection (X-Frame-Options header) against Click-Jacking attacks
vulnerability.long-description:
Clickjacking (User Interface redress attack, UI redress attack, UI redressing) is a malicious technique of tricking a Web user into clicking on something different from what the user perceives they are clicking on, thus potentially revealing confidential information or taking control of their computer while clicking on seemingly innocuous web pages.
The server didn't return an `X-Frame-Options` header which means that this website could be at risk of a clickjacking attack. The `X-Frame-Options` HTTP response header can be used to indicate whether or not a browser should be allowed to render a page inside a frame or iframe. Sites can use this to avoid clickjacking attacks, by ensuring that their content is not embedded into other sites.
vulnerability.fix-guidance: Configure your web server to include an X-Frame-Options header.
